title: Man indicted in death of his stepdaughter
content:
An East Toledo man whose 2-year-old stepdaughter was shot to death with a gun he had left in their home was indicted Tuesday by a Lucas County grand jury.
Turhan Johnson, 27, of the 2400 block of Seaman Street is charged with endangering children, a third-degree felony punishable by up to three years in prison, and negligent homicide, a first-degree misdemeanor that carries a possible jail term of 180 days.
Jeff Lingo, chief of the criminal division of the Lucas County Prosecutor’s Office, said the charges allege Mr. Johnson “left a loaded firearm within reach of small children, and that weapon discharged,” killing Journi Johnson.
